alert.note: Alert for White (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 8:32PM CST until February 10 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following river in Arkansas... Little Red River At Judsonia affecting White County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Little Red River At Judsonia. * WHEN...From this evening to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Minor flooding, farmland along the right descending bank floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 29.5 feet tomorrow morning (Feb 09). It will then fall to 21.9 feet by Monday evening (Feb 13). It will rise to 22.0 feet Wednesday morning (Feb 15). It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Little Red River Judsonia 30.0 24.7 Wed 8 PM 26.6 22.5 22.1 29.5 6 AM 2/09 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
